intro: Ouratea cataniapoensis, commonly known as the Cataniapoensis Ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, preferring humid and shaded environments. Its fruit is a capsule that releases small, winged seeds when mature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
